docs.snippet: The Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu, whose film "Biutiful" is nominated for a foreign-language Oscar, talks about the lessons he has learned from his three previous experiences as an Oscar nominee....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu first met the Spanish actor Javier Bardem at the Academy Awards in 2001. Both had been nominated for the first time: Mr. Gonzalez Iñárritu's "Amores Perros" for best foreign language film and Mr. Bardem for best actor in "Before Night Falls." And while neither won, afterward "our loser's party was the best," as Mr. Bardem recalled, and the two of them talked about collaborating.
docs.abstract: The Mexican director Alejandro González Iñárritu, whose film "Biutiful" is nominated for a foreign-language Oscar, talks about the lessons he has learned from his three previous experiences as an Oscar nominee.

headline.main: A Chat With the Man Behind 'Biutiful'

docs.snippet: Roger Ebert, the illustrious critic and Twitter maestro, predicts a near sweep for "The King's Speech," even though he preferred "The Social Network."...
docs.lead_paragraph: If you're already filling out your New York Times interactive Oscar ballot, and need a cheat sheet, check out Roger Ebert's picks. An illustrious critic and Twitter maestro, Mr. Ebert has posted his choices for every category, from short documentary to best picture, and he, too, thinks it will be a near sweep for "The King's Speech," even in categories like best supporting actor and best score. Personally, though, he preferred "The Social Network." ("It was not only the best film of 2010, but also one of those films that helps define a year," he writes.)
docs.abstract: Roger Ebert, the illustrious critic and Twitter maestro, predicts a near sweep for "The King's Speech," even though he preferred "The Social Network."

headline.main: An Ebert Cheat Sheet for Your Oscar Pool

docs.snippet: A lot of Academy voters ignore the nuances of the more technical races, which is one reason Sony Pictures Imageworks has been pedaling its little legs off on behalf of "Alice in Wonderland."...
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES- Most casual Oscar observers can't be bothered with the hinterland categories - art direction, sound mixing and the like. A lot of voters similarly ignore the nuances of those races, which is one reason Sony Pictures Imageworks has been pedaling its little legs off on behalf of "Alice in Wonderland."
docs.abstract: A lot of Academy voters ignore the nuances of the more technical races, which is one reason Sony Pictures Imageworks has been pedaling its little legs off on behalf of "Alice in Wonderland."
